All posts

  • Oktoberfest in Munich

    May 2021

    Germany’s most iconic Volkfest, Oktoberfest attracts millions of people to the city to enjoy Bavarian beer and food, live bands, and parades

  • Reeperbahn Festival in Hamburg

    Sept 2021

    Hamburg’s Reeperbahn Festival gives music fans a chance to enjoy a variety of genres and up-and-coming artists from across the world

  • Karneval in Cologne

    Nov 2021

    Karneval in Cologne feels like a massive costume party that lasts for about 6 days in the month of February, from Thursday to Tuesday

  • Cannstatter Volksfest in Stuttgart

    Mar 2022

    Cannstatter Volksfest kicks off with a spectacular street parade, with horse-drawn brewery wagons, locals dressed in traditional costumes, and marching bands

  • Wurstmarkt in Bad Dürkheim

    Jul 2022

    Every 1st and 3rd weekend of September, Wurstmarkt sees over 500,000 people celebrating 2 of Germany’s most popular exports – wine and wurst (sausage)

  • Berlinale Film Festival

    Dec 2022

    A festival for dedicated cinephiles, Berlinale showcases over 400 films of various genres and lengths

  • Weihnachtsmarkt

    Dec 2022

    If you’re in Berlin during wintertime, you can find not 1, but more than 20 Weihnachtsmarkts (Christmas markets) set up in historical buildings and city squares

  • Rhein in Flammen in Koblenz

    Sept 2023

    Rhein in Flammen (Rhine in Flames) is a series of spectacular firework displays and ship parades on the banks of Rhine

)
